title: Creating Effective Smoke Signals
brief: Generate smoke signals with contrasting colors for maximum visibility during daylight rescue.
steps: Step 1: Build a large fire as your base.
Step 2: Create color contrast - dark smoke against light background, white smoke against dark.
Step 3: For white smoke: smother fire with green leaves, moss, or small amount of water.
Step 4: For black smoke: add rubber or oil-soaked rags to the fire.
Step 5: Create three columns of smoke for international distress signal.
Step 6: Use only on calm, clear days for maximum effectiveness.
warnings: High winds, rain, or snow will disperse smoke and reduce visibility.
In desert environments, smoke hangs close to ground but is still visible to pilots.
Don't create smoke in dry conditions where it might start wildfires.
